== Manchester Lucid Ubuntu Global Jam Event Information ==

The Ubuntu Global Jam is an incredible opportunity for the Ubuntu community to unite together around the weekend of 26th - 28th March 2010 to work together to improve Ubuntu.

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UKTeam/ManchesterJam10-04|Main Event Page]]</nowiki>

=== Prerequisites ===

* Enthusiasm. No prior experience needed.
* A mug (for cups of tea).
* Laptop or netbook (or desktop if you're happy lugging it up stairs).
* An account at launchpad.net (can be done on the day).
* Gobby and an IRC client installed (can be done on the day).

=== On the day ===

==== Information ====
* How to connect to the wifi….
* The microblogging hashtag is #globaljam and #madjam
* The irc channel is #globaljam (for IRC instructions, see <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/community/chatirc]]</nowiki>)

==== Suggestions for things to do: ====

===== Upgrading =====
* Read the instructions at <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Jams/Upgrade]]</nowiki>
* Basic Steps:
*** Upgrade your system to Lucid by running sudo update-manager –d
*** After finishing the upgrade check that your system still works correctly. <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/UpgradeChecklist]]</nowiki> contains a simple checklist of things that worth a try.
*** File any bugs you may find. Tag them with the tags hardy2lucid or karmic2lucid. Check the Debugging Update Manager wiki page for a nice guide on how to report your upgrade bugs.
*** After the upgrade it would be nice if you could run System Testing (under System→Administration→System Testing) to gather information about your system. Submit the data to Launchpad.
*** Report “Pass or Failed in the corresponding ISO test case”..

===== ISO Testing =====
* Test the live CD/USB Stick and installer.
* Suitable for any user to do.
* Read the instructions at <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Jams/Testing]]</nowiki>
* Further help in #ubuntu-testing

===== Reporting Bugs =====
* To find out what a bug is (and general background information), see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs]]</nowiki> first.
* Suitable for any user to do.
* For more information, read <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ReportingBugs]]</nowiki>
* And see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU/TODO/Bugs]]</nowiki>

===== Triaging Bugs =====
* To find out what a bug is (and general background information), see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs]]</nowiki> first.
* No programming required!
* For more information, read <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToTriage]]</nowiki>
* And see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU/TODO/Bugs]]</nowiki>

===== Fixing Bugs =====
* To find out what a bug is (and general background information), see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs]]</nowiki> first.
* For more information, read <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/HowToFix]]</nowiki>
* And see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU/TODO/Bugs]]</nowiki>

===== Reviewing & Merging Patches =====
* This doesn't require an expert programmer!
* For more information see <nowiki>[[http://www.jonobacon.org/2010/03/22/help-needed-reviewing-and-merging-patches/]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuDevelopment/CodeReviews]]</nowiki>

===== Packaging =====
* Also, doesn't require programming skills (but does require experience with the command line).
* See <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Jams/Packaging]]</nowiki>
* And <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PackagingGuide]]</nowiki> (and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MOTU/GettingStarted]]</nowiki>)

===== Translations =====
* Suitable for any user to do.
* Ubuntu-UK Loco have a en-GB translation team! See <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EnglishTranslation]]</nowiki>
* For general information, go to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Jams/Translations]]</nowiki>
* For Scots, Gaelic and Welsh translation information, see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UKTeam/Translations]]</nowiki>

===== Documentation =====
* See <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Jams/Docs]]</nowiki>
* Suitable for any user to do.

===== Anything else! =====
* Read <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/participate/]]</nowiki>
* Also, go to <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UKTeam]]</nowiki> for project ideas or ask around on IRC!
